business.headline: Is Thane outshining Mumbai real estate with cheaper housing?Most new homes coming up in Thane are either 1BHK or 2BHK units. About 45% of new supply from 2020 to 2025 was 2BHKs, while 42% was 1BHKs. Larger homes like 3BHKs and 4BHKs together make up only around 13% of the new supply.

Personal loan rates 2025: How much are SBI, ICICI and others charging?Many banks in India have updated their personal loan interest rates for 2025. Most banks are offering rates starting from about 9.50% per year and going up to 10.50% for some customers, depending on their credit score and repayment ability.

TCS benching policy sparks fear among employees after first cycle: ReportThe policy, introduced on June 12, limits the time employees can remain without project work to just 35 days. After this, they face the risk of losing out on promotions or even losing their jobs.

New UPI rules: What happens if payments fail now?Earlier, if someone raised a chargeback, say, when money was deducted, but they did not get what they paid for, and it got declined, the bank had to go through an extra step.

Parliament panel proposes revival of key tax relief for companies: ReportThe government is set to restore Section 80M in the new Income Tax Bill, easing dividend tax burdens for companies. The bill is likely to pass in the Monsoon Session.

Are e-commerce firms hiding your rating? New survey reveals the truthThe survey asked consumers about their experience when posting negative reviews on e-commerce and quick commerce apps. Out of 16,519 responses, only 11% said their negative reviews were "published as is."
Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,200; SBI shares up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 41.02 points to 82,593.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.30 points to 25,198.75 as of 9:30 am.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces to list today. Will it make strong market debut?The company had set a price band of Rs 407 per share for the IPO. The total issue size was Rs 582.56 crore, which included a fresh issue of 1.09 crore shares worth Rs 445 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 34 lakh shares valued at Rs 137.56 crore.

Anthem Biosciences IPO: Allotment status live. GMP, listing details hereInvestors who applied for the Anthem Biosciences IPO can check their allotment status online through two platforms: the BSE website and the website of the IPO registrar, KFin Technologies.
Sensex closes 64 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 63.57 points to end at 82.634.48, while the NSE Nifty50 gained just 16.25 points to close at 25,212.05.

Gurugram's luxury flats, flooded streets: Is real estate bubble about to burst?Gurugram's luxury real estate may be booming, but repeated rain-induced flooding is testing its long-term value. If basic infrastructure fails, even the city's glitziest addresses could lose their appeal.

Is gold losing its shine? Here's why fewer people are investing in the yellow metalEarlier, gold symbolised family pride and social standing, but today's youngsters often see gold jewellery as outdated and instead put their money into things they believe will grow faster than gold ever could.

Fewer slabs, simpler rules? Next GST Council meet may trigger overhaulThe upcoming GST Council meeting, likely to be held in August 2025 after the monsoon session of Parliament, could bring key reforms in the way GST is structured and collected.

Housing sales slide 14% as affordability pressures mount across cities: ReportThe PropTiger report, which tracks sales and launches across major cities, found that the most significant annual drop was recorded in Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) and Pune, where sales fell by 32% and 27% respectively.

Why this IITian took up a guard's job to build Mygate, valued at Rs 1,600 croreMyGate has raised a total of $83.3 million across eight rounds. Its latest funding was in April 2023, a Series B round worth $3.29 million, putting its valuation at Rs 1,670 crore, according to Tracxn.

Tesla is finally in India. But can it go the distance?Tesla's India debut is a big milestone, but long-term success will depend on how well the company adapts to India's unique mix of pricing realities, policy expectations, and market dynamics.

Are private school fees draining India's middle class? CA shares eye-opening figuresWith fees climbing each year, parents are feeling the pinch more than ever. Maybe now is the right moment to pause, think, and ask ourselves, are we getting real value for this cost? Can we secure our kids' future without spending a fortune on fees? asks a Delhi-based CA.

SSY scheme: How your daughter can get Rs 71 lakh at 21It is a small savings scheme backed by the government, which offers high interest rates, tax benefits under Section 80C, and tax-free returns on maturity. Over 4.1 crore accounts have been opened so far under this scheme.

Good news soon for HDFC Bank shareholders? Here's all you need to knowHDFC Bank shares have delivered a 24% gain over the past year, with a year-to-date rise of nearly 13%. The stock has climbed more than 21% over the last six months, posting gains of 7% over the past three months and 4% in the previous month.

Did Ashok Leyland shares fall over 50% today? Details hereThe steep drop is the result of the company's 1:1 bonus issue, which came into effect on Wednesday. When a stock goes "ex-bonus," its price adjusts to reflect the additional shares being issued.
Sensex opens 69 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; HDFC Bank up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 197.64 points to 82,373.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 61.80 points to 25,134.00 as of 9:28 am.

Anthem Biosciences IPO to close for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMPThis IPO is entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares by existing shareholders. The company itself will not receive any money from this offer. The price band has been set at Rs 570 per share.

Big GST changes ahead? Centre signals green light, says reportThe Prime Minister's Office (PMO) has given an in-principle nod to a revamp of the GST structure, paving the way for possible reforms in the upcoming GST Council meeting scheduled for August.

The Theobroma story: How 2 sisters turned a cafe into 225-store pan-India chainPrivate equity firm ChrysCapital has struck a sweet deal to acquire a 90% stake in Theobroma Foods for Rs 2,410 crore. The bakery chain, started by two sisters in Mumbai, has grown into a 225-store brand loved for its brownies and cakes. Read on to know more about the Mumbai-based bakery chain.

MTNL misses Rs 8,585 crore payments, owes 7 public sector banksIn a filing on Tuesday, MTNL confirmed that it has defaulted on both principal and interest payments to a group of lenders, which include some of India's biggest state-owned banks.
Sensex ends 317 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 317.45 points to end at 82,570.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 113.50 points to close at 25,195.80.

Anthem Biosciences IPO fully booked: Should you subscribe? Check listing gainsThe IPO opened for subscription on July 14, aims to raise Rs 3,395 crore through a complete offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares.

Why Rs 12 crore didn't make this man happy? Investment advisor explainsWhile money matters, it should never cost you your health, peace of mind, or precious family time. True wealth is living well, not just stacking numbers in a bank account, says an investment advisor.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath wants short selling made easy in IndiaIf someone wants to short a stock today, they mostly do it through futures or options. But there's a catch, there are only 224 stocks in India that have futures and options. So if a bad company is not on that list, no one can short it easily.

Theobroma to be sold, Rs 2,410-crore sweet deal baked by ChrysCapital: ReportFounded in 2004 by sisters Kainaz Messman Harchandrai and Tina Messman Wykes, Theobroma began with a single outlet at Cusrow Baug on Mumbai's Colaba Causeway.

Claiming fake ITR refunds? Here's what could happenTo give honest taxpayers a chance to fix their mistakes, the department had earlier asked people to revise their returns if they had claimed any wrong deductions.

Filing ITR-2 or ITR-3? Check these common mistakes and tips to avoid themUsing the Excel utility for ITR-2 or ITR-3 seems easy, but it's easy to get stuck if you're not careful. One wrong entry can throw your entire tax calculation off. Here's a handy guide to avoid common slip-ups.

Explained: Why HCLTech shares are down 4% todayOver the past few days, HCLTech has been under pressure. The stock has declined 7.9% in the last five trading sessions, 9.58% in the past month, and over 14.6% in the past six months.

Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.
Sensex opens 119 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 176.33 points to 82,429.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.50 points to 25,145.80 as of 9:29 am.

Tesla's Model Y to debut in India at Rs 60 lakhIn comparison, the Model Y starts at $44,990 in the United States, 263,500 yuan in China, and 45,970 euros in Germany. This makes the Indian version one of the most expensive, mainly due to import duties and logistics costs.

Sensex, Nifty today: Inflation drops, but will stock markets rise?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,166 points around 8:22 am, suggesting a possible higher start for Nifty50, which closed at 25,082.3 on Monday. This points to cautious optimism on Dalal Street after four straight sessions of losses.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO allotment: Online guide to see status. Check GMPInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (also known as Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Bitcoin hits record $123,000 as US policy hopes boost crypto marketBitcoin is up about 30% so far this year and its rise has lifted other coins too. Ether, the second-biggest token, climbed to a five-month high of $3,059. XRP and Solana also rose about 3% each.

Retail inflation cools to 6-year low of 2.10% in JuneThis is the fifth month in a row that inflation has remained below the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) medium-term target of 4%, and the eighth consecutive month it has stayed under the central bank's upper limit of 6%

entertainment.headline: The Map That Leads To You trailer: Madelyn Cline, KJ Apa chase magic in EuropePrime Video is all set to release the romantic drama 'The Map That Leads To You' on August 20, featuring a heartfelt love story against the enchanting backdrop of Europe. Directed by Lasse Hallstrom, the film beautifully captures a journey of self-discovery and unexpected connections.

The ABC of stunts in Bollywood, Akshay Kumar's insurance and how it still is riskyBollywood has significantly improved stunt safety standards, highlighted by Akshay Kumar's initiative to provide health and accident insurance for hundreds of stunt professionals. Despite the inherent risks in stunt work, these measures offer vital protection and financial support to artistes in the Hindi film industry.

Hoppers trailer: A young scientist turns beaver in Avatar-inspired jungle adventureThe trailer of 'Hoppers' teases an 'Avatar'-esque jungle sci-fi, adventure-comedy. In the upcoming animation film, a young scientist hops into the body of a lifelike robotic beaver.

Saare Jahan Se Accha: Pratik Gandhi leads India's secret mission in espionage-dramaPratik Gandhi's upcoming series 'Saare Jahan Se Accha' is an espionage drama set in the 1970s. The show highlights the challenges faced by intelligence officers while protecting the nation from hidden threats.

Saiyaara advance booking: Ahaan Pandey could just be the new overnight sensationYRF's 'Saiyaara' is on its way to emerging as the biggest launchpad for any Bollywood debutant in a long time. Ahaan Pandey and Aneet Padda could just find their big claim to fame if the numbers are to be believed at the box office.

Ronit Roy breaks silence on rumours of replacing Sudhanshu Pandey in AnupamaaActor Ronit Roy refuted claims of joining 'Anupamaa' as Vanraj Shah. Roy said the rumours are not true. The role was earlier played by actor Sudhanshu Pandey, who quit the show in 2024.

Ishaan Khatter, Janhvi Kapoor's Homebound to screen at Toronto Film FestivalNeeraj Ghaywan's film 'Homebound', featuring Ishaan Khatter, Janhvi Kapoor, and Vishal Jethwa, has been selected for the prestigious Gala Presentations' category at the Toronto International Film Festival 2025. The film has already won hearts with a standing ovation at Cannes and boasts Martin Scorsese as an executive producer.

Aasif Khan shares photo from hospital bed, reads Rahat Indori's Main Zinda Hoon'Panchayat' actor Aasif Khan, who recently suffered a heart attack, is now recovering in hospital. He shared a photo reading Rahat Indori's book 'Main Zinda Hoon'.

Salman Khan roots for devi Sonakshi Sinha ahead of Nikita Roy, urges fans to watchSonakshi Sinha is making a grand return to the big screen with her supernatural thriller 'Nikita Roy', releasing on July 18. Salman Khan has expressed his excitement for the film, which promises a gripping story of an investigator challenging supernatural myths.

Barkha Bisht confirms joining Smriti Irani in Kyunki reboot, here's what she playsThe popular TV show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' is set to return, with Smriti Irani and Amar Upadhyay reprising their roles. Actor Barkha Bisht has also confirmed her inclusion in the cast.

Anupam Kher opens up on losing child with Kirron Kher, and life with SikandarAnupam Kher opens up about not having biological children with wife Kirron Kher, his bond with stepson Sikander, and how his career shaped personal choices. The veteran actor also opened up on Kirron's pregnancy, which didn't work due to complications.

Allu Arjun and family enjoy visit to Universal Studios in US, actor shares picsAllu Arjun, along with his wife, Sneha, and children, Ayaan and Arha, visited Universal Studios in the US. The actor and his wife shared pictures from their visit.

My baby, my vagina: Richa Chadha on criticism over natural birth remarkActor Richa Chadha celebrated her daughter Zuneyra's first birthday with a heartfelt post. She also firmly addressed the social media criticism over her natural birth remark.

Comedian Pete Davidson, girlfriend Elsie Hewitt announce pregnancyComedian Pete Davidson and girlfriend Elsie Hewitt are expecting their first child, confirmed by an Instagram post on July 16. The couple, who began dating earlier this year, shared the news with an ultrasound image.

Unforgivable: Rupali Ganguly slams Bangladesh for demolishing Satyajit Ray's homeRupali Ganguly strongly condemned the demolition of Satyajit Ray's ancestral home in Bangladesh, calling it 'disgusting and unforgivable'. The incident has sparked widespread anger across India and among Bengalis around the world.

Siddhant Chaturvedi hints at Gully Boy 2-Dhadak 2 crossover with Ishaan KhatterSiddhant Chaturvedi recently hinted at a surprising Bollywood crossover, suggesting a role reversal between him and Ishaan Khatter in Gully Boy 2 and Dhadak 2. He made a playful remark, saying "Dhadak 2 x Gully Boy 2," while mimicking Akshay Kumar's iconic swapping gesture from 'Ajnabee'.

10 Years of Bajrangi Bhaijaan: Director Kabir Khan shares BTS photos from setsDirector Kabir Khan marked 10 years of Bajrangi Bhaijaan by sharing memories and behind-the-scenes photos from the film's shoot. Fans flooded the post with requests to release the sequel soon.

Exclusive: Salman Khan recalls building his own bike, doing stunts for Bobby DeolSalman Khan opened up about his passion for bikes and performing stunts, sharing a rare story of building a bike from scratch. He emphasised the urgent need for better motorsport infrastructure in India to support aspiring riders.

Tomorrowland organisers issue statement after massive fire destroys main stageA massive fire broke out on the main stage of the Tomorrowland Festival in Belgium just two days before the event, causing severe damage. The organisers shared a statement on social media, stating that no harm occurred during the incident.

general news.headline: Servants of RCB: Karnataka argues against revoking cop's suspension over stampedeThe Karnataka government defended in court its suspension of IPS officer Vikash Kumar over the June 4 Bengaluru stadium stampede, arguing senior cops acted like "servants of the RCB" and failed crowd control.

Exclusive: Demolished house not Satyajit Ray's, says Bangladesh officialA house demolished in Bangladesh's Mymensingh was wrongly linked to Satyajit Ray's ancestors, Dhaka official confirmed, claiming that the iconic filmmaker's ancestral home, Durlov House, remained untouched.

Pilots' body objects amid new US report on 'role' of Captain in Air India crashA report in The Wall Street Journal, citing cockpit recordings, claimed the captain of the Air India jet cut the fuel flow to the engines. The government has urged the public to refrain from jumping to conclusions.

Pakistani Taliban recruiting actively in Bangladesh, but intel agencies cluelessThe Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) is actively recruiting in Bangladesh even as the security establishment remains oblivious to the threat. Two of the Bangladeshi recruits even travelled to Afghanistan with one being killed by the Pakistan Army. Recent arrests of TTP terrorists in Bangladesh have finally blown the lid off the operations.

Meet Animesh Kujur: India's fastest man, breaking one barrier at a timeAt just 22, Animesh Kujur is now India's fastest man yet. Hailing from a remote village in Chhattisgarh, he is rewriting the history of Indian track and field.

Court reverses custody order as child develops stress on separation from motherIn its previous order, the Supreme Court had upheld the Kerala High Court judgment granting permanent custody of the child to his father.

Praggnanandhaa stuns Magnus Carlsen with 39 moves in Freestyle Chess tournamentTeenage Indian Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa continued his strong form in 2025 with a statement victory over world number one Magnus Carlsen at the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas.
How India went the 'extra' mile in Lord's Test defeatThe margin of loss against England wasn't really 22 runs, but the 63 extras that Team India conceded in the match

It was touch and go, Obama quips as Michelle and he shut down divorce rumoursBarack and Michelle Obama, joined by Michelle's brother Craig Robinson, addressed divorce rumours for the first time with humour and sincerity, reaffirming their strong relationship.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Indore bags cleanest city title for 8th year, Noida tops in 3-10 lakh categoryIndore retained its cleanest city title for the eighth year in a row, with President Murmu conferring the Swachh Survekshan Awards that recognised urban bodies for innovation, sanitation and citizen participation.

Imran Khan claims 'harsh treatment' in jail, explains Asim Munir's grudgeIn a lengthy post on X, Imran Khan, who has been languishing in jail for the past two years along with his wife, said they were being deprived of basic human rights.
Early puberty is for real: How to help our childrenThe average age for first menstruation in India has dropped to around 12 years, and some girls are showing signs of puberty as early as age seven

Andhra Pradesh man kills 22-year old live-in partner for refusing prostitutionA 22-year-old woman was fatally stabbed by her live-in partner in Andhra Pradesh's Ambedkar Konaseema district after she refused to engage in prostitution. Her mother and brother were also injured.

9-year-old dies after suffering multiple heart attacks during school lunch breakA nine-year-old girl, a class 4 student at Adarsh Vidya Mandir in Sikar, died after suffering consecutive heart attacks within hours.

Why U.S. universities are opening campuses in India and the GulfGlobal demand, local reforms, and a hunger for quality education are redrawing the map of higher education, one global campus at a time.

Exclusive: Salman Khan recalls building his own bike, doing stunts for Bobby DeolSalman Khan opened up about his passion for bikes and performing stunts, sharing a rare story of building a bike from scratch. He emphasised the urgent need for better motorsport infrastructure in India to support aspiring riders.

10-year-old Tamil Nadu girl kidnapped, sexually assaulted while on way back homeA ten-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted in broad daylight in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur district while she was walking back home. The accused is said to have covered her mouth and kidnapped her.

Raj Thackeray party workers force man to apologise over anti-Marathi statusA shopkeeper was forced to apologise by MNS workers after he posted a social media status containing objectionable language about Marathi and Maharashtra.

Nitish Kumar's Bihar poll power play: Free electricity for up to 125 unitsBihar free electricity: The move, coming months ahead of the crucial Bihar Assembly elections, is expected to benefit 1.67 crore families in the state.

Range Rover Velar Autobiography launched in India at Rs 89.90 lakhRange Rover has launched the new Velar Autobiography in India, blending refined design, advanced features, and powerful performance to redefine luxury SUV standards, priced at Rs 89.90 lakh (ex-showroom).

Indian team capture rare images of interstellar comet from Ladakh's HanleThe comet, officially confirmed on July 1, 2025, by the Asteroid Terrestrial Impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) telescope in Chile, has quickly become a focal point for the global astronomical community.

Monster touched me: Girl in pain, cops say infection; court raps police for inactionSeeing how the police have not taken any action, the bench asked the prosecutor to take instructions if the Mumbai Police Commissioner will transfer it.

Gurugram couple earning Rs 60 LPA splits bills like 'flatmates', sparks debateThe Gurugram-based couple, each earning over Rs 30 lakh annually and working at reputed companies, meticulously split every shared expense - from rent and groceries to Swiggy orders - using tools like Splitwise or Google Sheets.

Joe Wright's Pride & Prejudice to re-release in theatres - all you need to knowJoe Wright's 'Pride & Prejudice' (2005), starring Keira Knightley and Matthew MacFadyen, returns to Indian theatres on July 25. Re-released by PVR INOX and UIP, the beloved adaptation offers fans a chance to relive Jane Austen's timeless romance on the big screen.

Despite the inherent risks in stunt work, these measures offer vital protection and financial support to artistes in the Hindi film industry.

sports.headline: Deepti not looking too far ahead of World Cup: Going one match at a timeDeepti Sharma is just taking it one game at a time. She does not want to get too ahead of herself and overwhelm her with the pressure of playing in the ODI World Cup. Instead she intends to take it a game at a time and focus on contributing each time.

Alastair Cook taunts bowlers over persistent ball change requestsFormer England captain Alastair Cook has added his voice—and a dose of humour—to the growing debate around the Dukes ball in the ongoing five-match Test series between England and India.

Japan Open 2025: Lakshya Sen, Satwik-Chirag eliminated in Round of 16 clashIndia's charge in the Japan Open is all but over as top stars like Lakshya Sen and the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty were eliminated from the tournament after losing their respective Round of 16 matches.

Gautam Gambhir will have to alter India's Jasprit Bumrah plan: David LloydFormer England cricketer David Lloyd feels India head coach Gautam Gambhir will have to alter their plans regarding Jasprit Bumrah to make a comeback in the ongoing series against England.

Ashwin recalls his father's bold prediction about Siraj in thrilling Lord's TestEngland vs India: Former Indian cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin shared an amusing anecdote, revealing that his father was confident Mohammed Siraj would finish the match by hitting three sixes.

Australia coach backs opener Sam Konstas after tough West Indies tourCricket Australia head coach Andrew McDonald has admitted the West Indies series has been "a difficult time" for Sam Konstas but rejected suggestions that the teenager has been damaged by the brutal experience.

Sabalenka withdraws from National Bank Open, opts for extra rest before US OpenWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka has pulled out of the upcoming National Bank Open in Montreal, opting to take additional rest as she prepares to defend her US Open title later this summer.

KL Rahul will outscore Shubman Gill in coming matches: Former England batterFormer England batter Owais Shah has backed KL Rahul to outscore Shubman Gill in the coming matches. Both Rahul and Gill have been in marvellous form in the ongoing series, having plundered runs in the first three matches.

Clive Lloyd urges complete overhaul of West Indies cricket after historic collapseClive Lloyd, the legendary former West Indies captain, has called for a serious and thorough review of cricket at all levels in the Caribbean. His remarks come in the wake of the West Indies Test team's shocking collapse against Australia, where they were dismissed for just 27 runs at Sabina Park.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
